title: Identify
text: Identify what you are solving for.

title: What Are You Solving For
text: You are solving for the Cruz's running speed.

title: Make a Variable
text: Create a variable to represent his running speed. Let the variable be x.

title: Time Elapsed
text: Determine how much time each part of the journey took using subtraction.

title: Time Elapsed Answer
text: 6:00 PM to 7:30 PM is 1.5 hours. 7:30 PM to 9:45 PM is 2.25 hours long. So, he spent 1.5 hours running and 2.25 hours biking.

title: Translate to Equation
text: Translate the situation into an equation using the variable. Remember that $$distance=speed time$$.

title: The Equation
text: Multiply the speeds by the time it takes for each respective part of the training to get the equation $$1.5x+\operatorname{2.25}\left(1.6x\right)=51$$ (this is the overall distance).

title: Solving the Equation
text: After solving the equation, what do you get for x?

subHints.title: Solving the Equation
subHints.text: To solve the equation $$1.5x+\operatorname{2.25}\left(1.6x\right)=51$$, we follow these steps: 1.5x+ 3.6x=51-->5.1x=51-->x=10.
